qas.question: What was one of organizations that was founded because of the Good Friday Agreement?
Which states belong to the British-Irish Council?

answers.text: all of the states and territories of the British Isles

qas.question: How many Oireachtas members where there in the original British-Irish Parliamentary Assembly?
How many members of the United Kingdom Parliament were in the British-Irish Parliamentary Assembly originally?
The British-Irish Council has added representatives from which parliament?
Which body, also established under the Tionol Agreement, is made up of the states and territories of the British Isles?
What body was established by the Good Friday Agreement and is made up of the states of Wales and Scotland?
In what year was the British-Scottish Parliamentary Assembly formed?
Establishing a mutual understanding between Britain and Ireland is the purpose of what body?
Representatives from where have been removed from the role and scope of the body?

context: Another body established under the Good Friday Agreement, the <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>British–Irish Council<b5_0/><a0_0/>,<b6_0/> is made up of <a1_0>all of the states and territories of the British Isles<a1_0/>. The <b8_0>British–Irish Parliamentary Assembly (<b8_0/>Irish: Tionól Pharlaiminteach na Breataine agus na hÉireann) predates the British–Irish Council and was established in <b7_0>1990<b7_0/>. Originally it comprised <a2_0>25<a2_0/> members of the Oireachtas, the Irish parliament, and <a3_0>25<a3_0/> members of the parliament of the United Kingdom, with the purpose of building mutual understanding between members of both legislatures. Since then the role and scope of the body has been expanded to include representatives from <b9_0>the <a4_0>Scottish Parliament<a4_0/>,<b9_0/> the National Assembly for Wales, the Northern Ireland Assembly, the States of Jersey, the States of Guernsey and the High Court of Tynwald (Isle of Man).
